You are given a string $s$ consisting of $n$ lowercase letters.  For each substring of $s$ of length $k$ ($1 \le k \le n$), find the length of the longest odd-length proper prefix of that substring. A proper prefix of a string is a prefix that is not the string itself.

For example, if $s = "bcabcabcabcabca"$ and $k=3$, then the 3-substring starting at index 0 is "bca". The longest odd-length proper prefix of "bca" is "b", which has length 1.

Output the length of the longest odd-length proper prefix for each substring of $s$. If there is no such prefix, output -1.
Given a string, for each possible substring of the string, find the length of the longest odd-length prefix that is also a suffix of that substring. If no such prefix exists, output -1.
